item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I've never been lonely. I've been in a room -- I've felt suicidal. I've been depressed. I've felt awful -- awful beyond all -- but I never felt that one other person could enter that room and cure what was bothering me...or that any number of people could enter that room. In other words, loneliness is something I've never been bothered with because I've always had this terrible itch for solitude. It's being at a party, or at a stadium full of people cheering for something, that I might feel loneliness. I'll quote Ibsen, "The strongest men are the most alone." I've never thought, "Well, some beautiful blonde will come in here and give me a fuck-job, rub my balls, and I'll feel good." No, that won't help. You know the typical crowd, "Wow, it's Friday night, what are you going to do? Just sit there?" Well, yeah. Because there's nothing out there. It's stupidity. Stupid people mingling with stupid people. Let them stupidify themselves. I've never been bothered with the need to rush out into the night. I hid in bars, because I didn't want to hide in factories. That's all. Sorry for all the millions, but I've never been lonely. I like myself. I'm the best form of entertainment I have. Let's drink more wine!" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: John add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "If I write what I feel, it's to reduce the fever of feeling. What I confess is unimportant, because everything is unimportant." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: John add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "pg 9, "The consciousness of life's unconsciousness is the oldest tax levied on the intelligence." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: John add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "I asked for very little from life, and even this little was denied me." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: John add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "Some of us think holding on makes us strong but sometimes it is letting go" -- Herman Hesse

item.title: John add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The best people possess a feeling for beauty, the courage to take risks, the discipline to tell the truth, the capacity for sacrifice. Ironically, their virtues make them vulnerable; they are often wounded, sometimes destroyed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: John add a quote by Hemingway, Ernest
item.description: "Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you." -- Hemingway, Ernest

item.title: John add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "On a long enough time line, the survival rate for everyone drops to zero." -- Chuck Palahniuk
